text: Outsider in the White House is a political memoir written by Huck Gutman and Bernie Sanders. It was first published as Outsider in the House in 1997. It was republished in 2015, when Sanders ran for President of the United States. The book contains an afterword by journalist John Nichols. The book talks about Sanders's support for the Second Amendment to the United States Constitution. This law gives United States citizens the right to own guns. ==References== Category:1997 books Category:2015 books Category:Bernie Sanders Category:American autobiographies
title: Outsider in the White House
